abstractText: These cruises are part of a long-term Bonneville Power Administration-funded effort by academic and federal scientists to understand coastal ecosystems and biological and physical processes that may influence recruitment variability of salmon in Pacific Northwest waters. Presently, research is focused on examining the effects of biotic and abiotic environmental conditions on the early marine life history of coho and Chinook salmon. This research focused on the Columbia River Plume and its importance for juvenile salmon and higher trophic level predators because this is an area of high salmonid abundance and it is influenced by anthropogenic factors.
title: NWFS_Center_Ocean Salmon Survey Ocean Water Chemistry and Chlorophyll Sampling v1.0
